intro: Jarava maeviae, commonly known as the Maevia jarava, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit with slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Jarava maeviae is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is an important component of local vegetation in its native range.
